revised_title: Investigations on the Occlusion of Residual Gas in Vacuum Tubes
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to understand how residual gas accumulates in the glass walls of vacuum tubes. They discovered that the gas, primarily hydrogen, is driven into the glass due to the bombardment of cathode rays. The authors also found that helium, when introduced into the vacuum tube, is absorbed by the glass, further supporting the idea that gas occlusion is a mechanical process rather than a chemical reaction.
